title: Using infoelectoral to make electoral maps
text: Install infoelectoral load packages needed.
code: # devtools::install_github("ropenspain/elecciones") # <--- Instala la librería elecciones  library(infoelectoral) # Cargo el resto de librerías library(sf) library(dplyr) library(tidyr)

title: Using infoelectoral to make electoral maps
text: Download results. case download election Congress decembre 2015.

title: Using infoelectoral to make electoral maps
text: Import geometry shapes municipalities using mapSpain.

title: Using infoelectoral to make electoral maps
text: Since parties different names throughout country, need recode group results. can use column code.nacional included resulting data.frame indicates grouping party code national level. ’ll create complete municipality code (LAU_CODE) merge sf object transform data long wide format.
code: siglas_r <- results %>%    group_by(codigo_partido_nacional) %>%    summarise(siglas_r = siglas[1]) %>%    filter(siglas_r %in% c("PP", "PSE-EE (PSO", "PODEMOS-AHA",                          "PODEMOS-COM", "PODEMOS-En", "C's", "EN COMÚ",                          "IU-UPeC")) %>%    mutate(siglas_r = case_when(     siglas_r %in% c("PODEMOS-COM", "PODEMOS-En", "EN COMÚ", "PODEMOS-AHA") ~ "Podemos",     siglas_r == "PSE-EE (PSO" ~ "PSOE",     siglas_r == "C's" ~ "Cs",     siglas_r == "IU-UPeC" ~ "IU",     TRUE ~ siglas_r        ))  results <- merge(results, siglas_r, by = "codigo_partido_nacional")  results <- results %>%    mutate(     # Construyo la columna que identifica al municipio (LAU_CODE)     LAU_CODE = paste0(codigo_provincia, codigo_municipio),     # Calculo el % sobre censo     pct = round((votos / censo_ine ) * 100, 2)     ) %>%    # Selecciono las columnas necesarias   select(codigo_ccaa, LAU_CODE, siglas_r, censo_ine, votos_candidaturas, pct) %>%    # Transformo los datos de formato long a wide   pivot_wider(names_from = "siglas_r", values_from = "pct")

what: Merge the data and the geometries
title: Using infoelectoral to make electoral maps
text: LAU_CODE column merge data geomtries municipalities. Since Canary Island far away going need get closer Iberian Peninsula.
code: shp <- merge(shp, results, by = "LAU_CODE")  # Acercamos las Canarias a la peninsula shp$geometry[shp$codigo_ccaa == "05"] <- shp$geometry[shp$codigo_ccaa == "05"] + c(5, 5)

title: Using infoelectoral to make electoral maps
text: last, may use tmap even ggplot visualize maps. case use formar ’s easier create facets.
code: colores5 <- list(c("#ededed", "#0cb2ff"), # PP                  c("#ededed", "#E01021"), # PSOE                  c("#ededed", "#612d62"), # Podemos                  c("#ededed", "#E85B2D"), # Cs                  c("#ededed", "#E01021")) # IU  breaks <- c(0,10,30,50,70,100)  library(tmap) mapa <- tm_shape(shp) +    tm_polygons(col = c("PP", "PSOE", "Podemos", "Cs", "IU"), style = "fixed",                palette = colores5, breaks = breaks,               title = "% sobre censo",                border.alpha = 0, lwd = 0, legend.show = T, legend.outside = T) +   tm_layout(between.margin = 5, frame = FALSE,             title = c("Partido Popular", "PSOE", "Podemos", "Ciudadanos", "Izquierda Unida"),             title.fontface = "bold") +   tm_legend(legend.text.size = 1,              legend.title.size = 1) +   tm_facets(sync = TRUE, ncol = 2) mapa

what: Descarga resultados electorales de España a nivel de mesa electoral del Ministerio del Interior
title: Descarga resultados electorales de España a nivel de mesa electoral del Ministerio del Interior
text: infoelectoral R library helps retrieve analize official electoral results Spain Ministry Interior. allows download results general, european municipal elections year polling station municipality level.

title: Descarga resultados electorales de España a nivel de mesa electoral del Ministerio del Interior
Descarga resultados electorales de España a nivel de mesa electoral del Ministerio del Interior
text: infoelectoral three functions: mesas() downloads electoral results data selected election polling station level. municipios() downloads electoral results data selected election municipality level. provincias() downloads electoral results data selected election constituency level. candidatos() downloads candidates data selected elections.

title: Descarga resultados electorales de España a nivel de mesa electoral del Ministerio del Interior
Download candidate data — candidatos
text: `candidatos()` downloads, formats imports environment data candidates electoral lists selected elections.

title: Download candidate data — candidatos
Download candidate data — candidatos
text: tipo_eleccion type choice want download. accepted values "congreso", "senado", "europeas" o "municipales". anno year election YYYY format. mes month election MM format. nivel administrative level data wanted ("mesa" polling stations "municipio" municipalities). necessary tipo_eleccion = "senado"

title: Download candidate data — candidatos
text: data.frame candidates data. tipo_eleccion = "senado" column called  `votos` included votes recieved candidate. type election selected column included since votes received specific candidates closed list party.

what: Administrative codes for spanish autonomous communities. — codigos_ccaa

title: Administrative codes for spanish autonomous communities. — codigos_ccaa
Administrative codes for spanish autonomous communities. — codigos_ccaa
text: dataset 19 rows 3 columns: codigo_ccaa Code given autonomous communities Ministry Interior (National Institute Statistics codes) codigo_ccaa_ine Code given autonomous communities National Institute Statistics provincia Official name provinces

title: Administrative codes for spanish autonomous communities. — codigos_ccaa
text: https://infoelectoral.interior.gob.es/opencms/es/elecciones-celebradas/area-de-descargas/

what: Administrative codes for spanish municipalities. — codigos_municipios
title: Administrative codes for spanish municipalities. — codigos_municipios
text: dataset contains INE codes municipalities Spain recent names (eg: Cabrera d'Igualada appears Cabrera d'Anoia). municipalities merged point, codes kept separately along new municipality created (eg: contains municipality Oza-Cesuras also Cesuras Oza dos Ríos separately).

title: Administrative codes for spanish municipalities. — codigos_municipios
Administrative codes for spanish municipalities. — codigos_municipios
text: dataset 8.000 rows 3 columns: codigo_provincia Code given provinces National Institute Statistics codigo_municipio Code given municipalities National Institute Statistics municipio recent official name municipality

title: Administrative codes for spanish municipalities. — codigos_municipios
text: https://www.ine.es/dyngs/INEbase/es/operacion.htm?c=Estadistica_C&cid=1254736177031&menu=ultiDatos&idp=1254734710990

title: Recoded party names — codigos_partidos
text: dataset contains list recoded electoral party coalition names correspondent national codes. example: 'PSOE' original name 'PSA-PSOE', 'PSOE-PROGR.' 'PSOE-'. recodification helps longitudinal analysis electoral results, avoiding many variations party coalition names.

title: Recoded party names — codigos_partidos
Recoded party names — codigos_partidos
text: dataset names electoral party coalition anno Year election mes Month election codigo_partido_nacional national accumulation code electoral party coalition partido recoded name electoral party coalition.

title: Administrative codes for spanish provinces. — codigos_provincias
Administrative codes for spanish provinces. — codigos_provincias
text: dataset 52 rows 5 columns: codigo_ccaa Code given autonomous communities Ministry Interior (National Institute Statistics codes) codigo_ccaa_ine Code given autonomous communities National Institute Statistics ccaa Official name autonomous communities codigo_provincia Code given provinces National Institute Statistics provincia Official name provinces

title: Administrative codes for spanish provinces. — codigos_provincias
